Th e presence of skilled attendants is therefore, crucial for the early detection and also for 
appropriate and timely management of such complications. Th e Government of India (GoI) 
has a commitment under its National Rural Health Mission (NRHM)/Reproductive and 
Child Health (RCH)-II programme to ensure universal coverage of all births with skilled 
attendance, both at the institutional and at the community level and
